en.misuse: Not to be used for recording information related to other pediatric blunt abdominal trauma rules.

other_details.references: Streck CJ, Vogel AM, Zhang J, Huang EY, Santore MT, Tsao K, Falcone RA, Dassinger MS, Russell RT, Blakely ML; Pediatric Surgery Research Collaborative. Identifying Children at Very Low Risk for Blunt Intra-Abdominal Injury in Whom CT of the Abdomen Can Be Avoided Safely. J Am Coll Surg. 2017 Apr;224(4):449-458.e3. doi: 10.1016/j.jamcollsurg.2016.12.041. Epub 2017 Jan 24. PMID: 28130170.
other_details.en: An assessment score used to identify pediatric patients (<16 years) at very low risk of intra-abdominal injury after blunt abdominal trauma.

gt0001.text: Pediatric Surgery Research Collaborative (PedSRC) Rule for Blunt Abdominal Trauma
gt0001.description: An assessment score used to identify pediatric patients (<16 years) at very low risk of intra-abdominal injury after blunt abdominal trauma.
